main event: A civilian employee observed an unidentified flying object resembling a Davis Arc Ving over Eau Gallie, Florida on 2 June 1954.
interesting points: The object had more than 10 reddish blue lights and was at an altitude of 500 to 700 feet., The object moved at a very fast speed before departing in a banking motion., The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes., The report concluded the sighting was astronomical (i.e., a star)., There is no physical evidence and the report noted there were no other witnesses.
sighted object: unidentified flying object resembling a Davis Arc Ving with reddish blue lights
witness description: civilian employee in the photo lab
